title: FBI visit to Bearea Elementary School in Montgomery NY Pre-09/2001 (Department of Homeland Security)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records regarding; What purpose did FBI agent Daniel [Murano] have in visiting berea elementary school in the months and years prior to september 2001. 
What role did the CIA agent Daniel [K.] have in the forming of the department of homeland security and what is his current role at the DHS?
Why were these two agents sent to Berea Elementary in the time period between 1998, 1999, 2000, and 2001?
What documents and videos do you have pertaining to these visits?
What was the last official visit each of these agents and their cohorts to Berea elementary in montgomery new york?
What was the subject of each of these visits?
Can you release sign in and sign out logs from by these agents and their cohorts from the school visitor sign in sheet?
What credentials can you release regarding these agents?

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anonymouse

title: Request for Body-Worn Camera Footage – Kebert Jean – Arrest on 10/24/2024

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Request for Body-Worn Camera Footage – Kebert Jean – Arrest on 10/24/2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to any available body-worn camera footage associated with the arrest of Kebert Jean, which took place on October 24, 2024, at or near MacArthur Causeway (W/B) / Terminal Isle, Miami Beach, FL 33139. The incident reportedly began on or around August 13, 2024, near 1058 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139.

Charges include:

Armed Robbery with a Firearm (F.S. 812.13(2)(A))

Kidnapping (F.S. 787.01(1))

Fraudulent Use of Credit Card – $100 or More (F.S. 817.61)

Fraudulent Use of Personal Identification (F.S. 817.568(2)(A))

The arresting officers include Officer Vicens (Court ID: 002-02172), with additional involvement by Officer Lanier (Court ID: 002-00676) and Officer Dominguez (Court ID: 002-01060), all affiliated with the Miami Beach Police Department. BWC usage is noted in the arrest affidavit.

The police case number is: 202400082630
The court case number is: F24022429

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

mich

title: Drug Sniffing Dogs LA County Probation

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Drug Sniffing Dogs LA County Probation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting records related to the BOS contract with Interquest Detection Canines and their use by the Probation Department:

Records that track the contractor's performance history
Monthly self-monitoring reports of compliance with the Statement of Work and submit such to the County’s Program Manager
Detection rates and their accuracy, including the number of contraband found and seized, and false positives.
SUBSTANCES DETECTED reports
Quality Control Plans

Search 2024 to today's date

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

title: Records Pertaining to Colonel Kurush Bharucha-Reid (“KB Reid”) (Dept of the Army US Army Human Resources Command)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Records Pertaining to Colonel Kurush Bharucha-Reid (“KB Reid”) (Dept of the Army US Army Human Resources Command)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

This request seeks all records from 1995 (or earlier) to 2010 (or later if available) referencing Colonel Kurush Bharucha-Reid (also known as “KB Reid”), a U.S. Army Military Intelligence officer who was selected for the Military Intelligence Excepted Career Program (GREAT SKILL) in 1987 and subsequently served in some of the most sensitive Army and interagency HUMINT roles of the post–Cold War and post-9/11 era.

I respectfully request:

	1.	Personnel Records
	•	Official Military Personnel File (OMPF), Officer Evaluation Reports (OERs), commendations, promotions, awards, fitness reports, assignment orders, and internal performance evaluations for Colonel Kurush Bharucha-Reid (SSN/Service Number can be provided if required).
	•	Decorations including: Defense Superior Service Medal, Bronze Star (with Oak Leaf Cluster), Defense Meritorious Service Medal (x3), Meritorious Service Medal (x3), Joint Service Commendation Medal, Army Commendation Medal (with Oak Leaf Cluster), Army Achievement Medal, Ranger tab, Special Forces tab, Pathfinder, Master Parachutist, and Military Free Fall Jump Master badges ￼.
	2.	Program and Command Assignments
	•	All records documenting his service in the GREAT SKILL Program, including appointment, reassignment memos, or internal assessments.
	•	His service as Regional Desk Officer and Special Assistant for Military Affairs at a national-level intelligence agency, with a focus on East Asian and Near East operations.
	•	Records from his time as Commander of a Defense HUMINT Service base in Bosnia, and as CJ2 for Combined Joint Task Force Fervent Archer.
	•	Documentation from his command of a sensitive HUMINT collection detachment deployed to Afghanistan (2002), where he served as the first HUMINT case officer supporting U.S. Special Operations Command (USSOCOM).
	•	Records from his second Afghanistan deployment (2004), where he commanded a HUMINT base supporting surge operations during Afghanistan’s first democratic elections.
	•	Internal records, rosters, orders, or awards tied to his 2005 Iraq deployment as a Senior HUMINT Advisor in a sensitive interagency coordination cell.
	3.	Strategic Instruction & Final Command
	•	Records of his time as Chief of the Military Group and Senior DoD Instructor at a joint interagency strategic intelligence training institution (likely DIA or a multi-agency DoD school).
	•	Materials from his command of the U.S. Army Field Support Center (AFSC) beginning in May 2009, including speeches, directives, or internal comms.
	•	Any documentation of his death from pancreatic cancer in 2010, honors received, or correspondence related to his funeral and burial at Arlington National Cemetery on September 9, 2010.
	4.	Legacy Sites and Honors
	•	Records regarding the 2011 naming of the DIA Contingency Operating Base in Kabul as Camp K.B. Reid, including naming justification, interagency approvals, and dedication ceremony photos or memos.
	•	Materials related to the Reid Center (DIA’s training facility in Norfolk, VA, established in 2012 and now closed).
	•	The establishment of the COL Kurush Bharucha-Reid Award for Excellence in HUMINT Tradecraft in 2014 by the HUMINT Training – Joint Center of Excellence, including award criteria, selection board minutes, and awardee names.
	•	Any correspondence, ceremony documentation, or Hall of Fame entry details from his 2014 induction into the Military Intelligence Corps Hall of Fame ￼.
	5.	Photographic and Ceremonial Records
	•	All official photographs, eulogies, obituaries, citations, press releases, internal honors, or other agency acknowledgments related to Col. Bharucha-Reid, both during service and posthumously.
	6.	Classified and Segregable Records
	•	If any records are classified, please initiate a mandatory declassification review (MDR) under Executive Order 13526 and release all segregable non-exempt portions under FOIA guidelines.
	7.	Delivery and Fee Waiver
	•	Please provide documents in searchable PDF format via secure email or download link.

This request supports a public-interest historical and educational project—specifically, a feature film titled Undercover Patriot exploring the intersection of identity, secrecy, and service. 

As a fellow Parsi Zoroastrian American, I believe Col. Bharucha-Reid’s legacy deserves recognition beyond the classified corridors in which he served.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adil Minocherhomjee

title: Records Pertaining to Colonel Kurush Bharucha-Reid (“KB Reid”) (Department of Defense, Freedom of Information Policy Office)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Records Pertaining to Colonel Kurush Bharucha-Reid (“KB Reid”) (Department of Defense, Freedom of Information Policy Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

This request seeks all records from 1995 (or earlier) to 2010 (or later if available) referencing Colonel Kurush Bharucha-Reid (also known as “KB Reid”), a U.S. Army Military Intelligence officer who was selected for the Military Intelligence Excepted Career Program (GREAT SKILL) in 1987 and subsequently served in some of the most sensitive Army and interagency HUMINT roles of the post–Cold War and post-9/11 era.

I respectfully request:

	1.	Personnel Records
	•	Official Military Personnel File (OMPF), Officer Evaluation Reports (OERs), commendations, promotions, awards, fitness reports, assignment orders, and internal performance evaluations for Colonel Kurush Bharucha-Reid (SSN/Service Number can be provided if required).
	•	Decorations including: Defense Superior Service Medal, Bronze Star (with Oak Leaf Cluster), Defense Meritorious Service Medal (x3), Meritorious Service Medal (x3), Joint Service Commendation Medal, Army Commendation Medal (with Oak Leaf Cluster), Army Achievement Medal, Ranger tab, Special Forces tab, Pathfinder, Master Parachutist, and Military Free Fall Jump Master badges ￼.
	2.	Program and Command Assignments
	•	All records documenting his service in the GREAT SKILL Program, including appointment, reassignment memos, or internal assessments.
	•	His service as Regional Desk Officer and Special Assistant for Military Affairs at a national-level intelligence agency, with a focus on East Asian and Near East operations.
	•	Records from his time as Commander of a Defense HUMINT Service base in Bosnia, and as CJ2 for Combined Joint Task Force Fervent Archer.
	•	Documentation from his command of a sensitive HUMINT collection detachment deployed to Afghanistan (2002), where he served as the first HUMINT case officer supporting U.S. Special Operations Command (USSOCOM).
	•	Records from his second Afghanistan deployment (2004), where he commanded a HUMINT base supporting surge operations during Afghanistan’s first democratic elections.
	•	Internal records, rosters, orders, or awards tied to his 2005 Iraq deployment as a Senior HUMINT Advisor in a sensitive interagency coordination cell.
	3.	Strategic Instruction & Final Command
	•	Records of his time as Chief of the Military Group and Senior DoD Instructor at a joint interagency strategic intelligence training institution (likely DIA or a multi-agency DoD school).
	•	Materials from his command of the U.S. Army Field Support Center (AFSC) beginning in May 2009, including speeches, directives, or internal comms.
	•	Any documentation of his death from pancreatic cancer in 2010, honors received, or correspondence related to his funeral and burial at Arlington National Cemetery on September 9, 2010.
	4.	Legacy Sites and Honors
	•	Records regarding the 2011 naming of the DIA Contingency Operating Base in Kabul as Camp K.B. Reid, including naming justification, interagency approvals, and dedication ceremony photos or memos.
	•	Materials related to the Reid Center (DIA’s training facility in Norfolk, VA, established in 2012 and now closed).
	•	The establishment of the COL Kurush Bharucha-Reid Award for Excellence in HUMINT Tradecraft in 2014 by the HUMINT Training – Joint Center of Excellence, including award criteria, selection board minutes, and awardee names.
	•	Any correspondence, ceremony documentation, or Hall of Fame entry details from his 2014 induction into the Military Intelligence Corps Hall of Fame ￼.
	5.	Photographic and Ceremonial Records
	•	All official photographs, eulogies, obituaries, citations, press releases, internal honors, or other agency acknowledgments related to Col. Bharucha-Reid, both during service and posthumously.
	6.	Classified and Segregable Records
	•	If any records are classified, please initiate a mandatory declassification review (MDR) under Executive Order 13526 and release all segregable non-exempt portions under FOIA guidelines.
	7.	Delivery and Fee Waiver
	•	Please provide documents in searchable PDF format via secure email or download link.

This request supports a public-interest historical and educational project—specifically, a feature film titled Undercover Patriot exploring the intersection of identity, secrecy, and service. 

As a fellow Parsi Zoroastrian American, I believe Col. Bharucha-Reid’s legacy deserves recognition beyond the classified corridors in which he served.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adil Minocherhomjee

title: Muhammadu Buhari (17 December 1942 – 13 July 2025)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Muhammadu Buhari (17 December 1942 – 13 July 2025)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into former Nigerian leader Muhammadu Buhari (17 December 1942 – 13 July 2025). His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find his Washington Post obituary at the following link: https://www.washingtonpost.com/obituaries/2025/07/13/muhammadu-buhari-nigeria-dead/

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

title: Mike Firestone's emails regarding mass and cass 2

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Mike Firestone's emails regarding mass and cass 2
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I hereby request all emails sent or received by Mike Firestone (both @boston.gov and any external on- or off‑government accounts) from September 1, 2023, through the date of fulfillment that contain any of the following keywords:

"Mass and Cass", "Methadone Mile", "Recovery Road", "overdose", "opioid", "fentanyl", "heroin", "narcan", "shelter", "homeless", "encampment", "tent city", "drug use", "public drug use", "open drug scene", "syringe", "Engagement Center", "Project TRUST", "harm reduction", "transitional housing", "low-barrier housing", "daycenter", "public safety", "violence", "crime", "stabbing", "trafficking", "mental health", "addiction", "substance use disorder", "EMS", "emergency calls", "overdoses reversed", "Long Island", "bridge", "recovery campus", "street outreach", "engagement", "sobriety requirements" "ahope" "BPHC" "Boston Public Health Commission"  any variations of "Dr Ojutiku" ( ie "Dr.O" "Dr O" "BISOLA"  "BISOLA Ojutiku" Capital lower case),  "727"  "congregate outdoor drug use" "congregate outdoor substance use" "drug" "drugs" "substance"  "Substance use" "woods mullen" "WMS"	"SHS" " "southampton shelter" "shelter" "atkinson" "encampment" "ACLU"

Please include complete metadata (to/from/date/subject) We request these records be provided in an accessible digital format. 

Please confirm which keywords have no responsive documents and what systems have been searched.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian McCarter

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

This is a matter of public interest in order to understand if the ICE employees are local citizens who understand the community in which we live, versus employees based in other parts of the country who do not have an understanding of our community. 

This request furthers public interest given, in particular, that numerous individuals claiming to represent ICE have been documented (1) wearing masks, (2) refusing to show government-issued identification corroborating their affiliation with ICE, CBP, USCIS, and/or local law enforcement. Furthermore, there have been incredibly concerning instances of (3) non-LEOs dressing as LEOs who kidnap or attempt to kidnap residents in our community.

As a white, natural-born US-citizen, I respectfully submit this request to ensure the safety of the community where I reside, the State of Oregon, and individuals and communities impacted by these activities.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: Tiger Team

communications.subject: DC Freedom of Information Act Request: Tiger Team
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the DC Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I seek all records related to a special Department of Homeland Security task force known internally as the “Tiger Team.” 

On July 10, 2025, Homeland Security Investigations official Peter Hatch testified in American Association of University Professors v. U.S. Department of Justice, Civ. No. 1:25-cv-10910 (D. Mass). Hatch testified that in early 2025, DHS convened a special task force known internally as the “Tiger Team”  to identify noncitizens protesting against Israel’s ongoing genocide of the Palestinian people, revoke their legal immigration status, and have them deported.

I request all records related to the Tiger Team. These include, without limitation:

1. All records related to the conception and creation of Tiger Team. 
2. Records sufficient to identify the structure, composition, and membership of Tiger Team. 
3. Records sufficient to identify the mission and mandate of Tiger Team.
4. All records related to the activities of Tiger Team.
5. Records sufficient to identify all other government persons and entities with which Tiger Team has collaborated, interacted, or corresponded.
6. Records sufficient to identify all non-government persons and entities with which Tiger Team has collaborated, interacted, or corresponded.
7. All records related to the oversight of Tiger Team, including records sufficient to identify the persons and entities responsible for that oversight.

Date Range: November 5, 2024 to July 12, 2025.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Francis Lee Maidir

title: FOIA Request – Records Related to February 2022 Appointment of Interim Executive Director Mark A. Robbins

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Request – Records Related to February 2022 Appointment of Interim Executive Director Mark A. Robbins
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear FOIA Officer,

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552), I respectfully request access to the following records:

All documents, meeting minutes, internal communications, and voting records related to the appointment of Mark A. Robbins as Interim Executive Director of the U.S. Election Assistance Commission, finalized by Commission vote on or around February 8, 2022.

Specifically, I request:

The official vote tally (including whether the vote was unanimous or divided) from the Commissioners.

Any Commission meeting minutes, agendas, transcripts, or decision memos related to the appointment.

Emails or internal memos exchanged between EAC Commissioners, staff, or legal counsel discussing Robbins’s selection between January 1, 2022 and February 15, 2022.

The final memorandum of appointment or resolution documenting Robbins’s installation as Interim Executive Director.

Any dissenting opinions, abstentions, or formal statements of support or opposition filed by any Commissioner during the appointment process.

Please include all responsive records regardless of format (email, PDF, meeting notes, etc.).

If parts of this request are exempt from disclosure, please release any reasonably segregable portions of the otherwise exempt material as required by 5 U.S.C. § 552(b).

FEE WAIVER: 

As a journalist reporting for the public on matters of federal election oversight and administrative transparency, I request a waiver of all search and reproduction fees. The information sought is in the public interest and is not being requested for commercial purposes. The findings will be used in an investigative report published by Dissent in Bloom, which regularly covers federal agencies and election infrastructure.

If any part of this request is denied, please provide a written justification, including the specific exemption(s) claimed, and release all segregable non-exempt portions.

If any portion of this request is denied, please inform me of the specific exemption(s) claimed for each withheld record or portion thereof, and describe the procedures available to appeal your decision.

I look forward to receiving your response within the statutory time period of twenty (20) working days. If you have any questions regarding this request, please contact me at the phone number or email address provided above.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

title: “Responsible Party” Designations and COVID‑19 Plan Communications (School Year 2021‑22)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: “Responsible Party” Designations and COVID‑19 Plan Communications (School Year 2021‑22)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to New York Public Officers Law §84 et seq. (FOIL), I hereby submit this as a brand new request for the following records held by the Niskayuna Central School District. This request supersedes and clarifies the February 7, 2022, request (MuckRock #124465-34497783; link: https://www.muckrock.com/foi/niskayuna-23437/foil-responsible-party-identification-and-communications-niskayuna-central-school-district-124465/), which was denied on March 25, 2022, for no responsive records. A timely appeal was filed March 31, 2022, under 21 NYCRR 1401.7(d), but the District's July 15, 2022, response addressed a later purported appeal and deemed it waived without acknowledging the initial filing or merits, raising concerns about timeline tracking and search adequacy.

The requested records are:

“RESPONSIBLE PARTY” DESIGNATIONS
• All documents, plans, submissions, or records where the designation of “Responsible Parties” is attested or identified under the NYS Department of Health document Interim Guidance for In‑Person Instruction at Pre‑K–12 Schools During the COVID‑19 Public Health Emergency (7 June 2021) for School Year 2021‑2022 (1 July 2021 – 30 June 2022), including any related attestations, affirmations, or sections of reopening plans that specify their roles, responsibilities, or identities.
• Any bonding or insurance certificates held specifically for those individuals in that capacity.

COVID‑19 REOPENING / IN‑PERSON INSTRUCTION PLANS
• All versions (initial submission, amendments, updates) of the District’s COVID‑19 reopening or in‑person instruction plan filed with NYSDOH or NYSED between 1 July 2021 and 30 June 2022, including cover letters or transmittal e‑mails.

AFFIRMATIONS OF COMPLIANCE
• Every written affirmation or certification sent to NYSDOH, NYSED, or the Schenectady County Department of Health in which a District official attested that the District would adhere to—or had read and understood—the above‑referenced DOH guidance during the same period.

EXTERNAL E‑MAIL CORRESPONDENCE ABOUT THE PLAN
Search only these District accounts: Superintendent, Director of Business & Finance, District Clerk, and any individual identified in the documents responsive to Item 1.
Time frame: 1 July 2021 – 30 June 2022
Keywords (Boolean OR): “COVID” “Responsible Party” “reopening plan” “Core Health” “containment” “closure” “monitoring”
Produce incoming and outgoing e‑mails (with attachments) exchanged with:
• @health.ny.gov (NY Department of Health)
• @nysed.gov (NY State Education Department)
• @schenectadycounty.com (or equivalent) (Schenectady County DOH)


Given prior delays—where no response to the initial appeal occurred within 10 business days under §89(4)(a), creating a constructive denial—and similar patterns in other requests (per COOG AOs like FOIL-AO-14913 and FOIL-AO-14159 on constructive denials from non-response or unauthorized extensions), I request immediate acknowledgment and determination. This is supported by cases such as Matter of Jewish Press, Inc. v. New York City Dept. of Corr. (183 A.D.3d 731 [2d Dept. 2021]) and Matter of Save Monroe Ave., Inc. v. New York State Dept. of Transp. (197 A.D.3d 808 [3d Dept. 2021]), emphasizing that inaction undermines openness, and COOG AO-19372 on delays from ignored appeals.

To avoid loss, preserve all responsive records per COOG AO-16073 (retention until resolution) and before LGS-01 timelines expire (e.g., 1 year for correspondence, 6 years for policy records), confirming in acknowledgment.

Provide records electronically (PDF for documents; .eml/.msg for e-mail) to minimize costs; I certify non-commercial use. For denials/redactions, release segregable portions with exemption log citing §87(2) subdivision and appeal rights. Acknowledge within 5 business days and respond or extend (with date-certain) within 20, per §89(3)(a).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

Moe Clark

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fkittitas-county-prosecuting-attorney-35225%252Fpolice-disciplinary-files-kittitas-county-prosecuting-attorney-189458%252F%253Femail%253Dprosecutor%252540co.kittitas.wa.us&url_auth_token=AAGleo7StUZuCJlmYkVrqjLZ9IU%3A1ub9sS%3AkfyH1rD4bpI5NgUk9A-AZfRpcLO27THLFEeB3bDUuFw" A Public Records Officer of the Public Defense will be helping you with your records request. Kittitas County, WA

communications.subject: Your Skagit County, WA public records request #25-1232 has been submitted.
communications.communication:
Skagit County, WA ************************************************************************ Your record request #25-1232 has been submitted successfully. Thank you for submitting your request to Skagit County Records Department. Someone from our records team will respond as required by RCW 42.56.520, within five business days. ln calculating the five business days, the following are not counted: the day the county receives the request, Saturdays, Sundays and holidays. RCW 1.12.040. See also WAC 44-14-03006. lf the request is received by the County after County business hours. the request shall be deemed to have been received by the county on the next business day. A response may be (a) providing the records, (b) providing a link to records available online, (c) providing a reasonable estimated date of when the records will be available, (d) requesting clarification, or (e) denial of the request. If you have any questions or concerns, please contact me at 360-416-1152, or by email at pherman@co.skagit.wa.us. Sincerely, Pamela Herman Certified Public Records Officer, Central Services Skagit County 360-416-1152 Public Records Act (PRA) Notice. Any information, including certain personal information, submitted to the County by e-mail or other method may be subject to disclosure as a public record under RCW chapter 42.56.  ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact Skagit County, WA.
